intro: Cylicodaphne wightiana var. glabrescens, commonly known as the smooth cylicodaphne, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant is evergreen and thrives in humid, tropical climates with well-drained soil. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and compact growth habit. Its varietal name, *glabrescens*, refers to its smooth, hairless leaves, distinguishing it from other varieties in the species.
